title: Level 2 Space Practice Test
description: Test your skills with 2D shapes, symmetry and giving directions!

questions.question: How many sides does a pentagon have?
questions.explanation: A pentagon has 5 sides and 5 corners. The prefix 'penta' means five.

questions.question: Which shape has 4 equal sides and 4 square corners?
questions.explanation: A square has 4 sides that are all the same length and 4 square corners (right angles). A rectangle also has 4 square corners but its sides are not all equal.

questions.question: Which shape has no straight sides and no corners?
questions.explanation: A circle has no straight sides (its edge is one continuous curve) and no corners.

questions.question: How many lines of symmetry does a square have?
questions.explanation: A square has 4 lines of symmetry: one vertical, one horizontal and two diagonal. Each one divides the square into two matching halves.

questions.question: You are facing north. You turn right. Which direction are you now facing?
questions.explanation: If you face north and turn right, you face east. The order going clockwise is: North, East, South, West.

questions.question: A shape has 3 sides and 3 corners. One side is longer than the other two. What type of shape is it?
questions.explanation: Any shape with 3 sides and 3 corners is a triangle. Triangles can have sides of different lengths -- they don't all have to be equal.

questions.question: How many corners does a hexagon have?
questions.explanation: A hexagon has 6 sides and 6 corners. For straight-sided shapes, the number of sides always equals the number of corners.

questions.question: How many lines of symmetry does a rectangle (that is not a square) have?
questions.explanation: A rectangle has 2 lines of symmetry: one vertical (left-right) and one horizontal (top-bottom). The diagonals are NOT lines of symmetry for a non-square rectangle.

questions.question: What is the name of a flat shape with 4 sides where all corners are square corners but NOT all sides are the same length?
questions.explanation: A rectangle has 4 sides with all square corners (right angles). Unlike a square, a rectangle can have sides of different lengths (two long sides and two short sides).

questions.question: The letter M has one line of symmetry. Is it vertical (up-down) or horizontal (left-right)?
questions.explanation: The letter M has a vertical line of symmetry. If you draw a line from top to bottom through the middle, the left half mirrors the right half.
